title: Petrobras announced binding phase of Polo Garoupa oil fields sale - Nasdaq.com
text: BRASILIA, Sept 2 (Reuters) - Brazil's state-run oil company, Petroleo Brasileiro SA,  announced the binding phase of the sale of its 11 oil fields in shallow waters of the Campos basin and collectively known as Polo Garoupa.

Petrobras said in a securities filing that oil fields called  Anequim, Bagre, Cherne, Congro, Corvina, Malhado, Namorado, Parati, Garoupa, Garoupinha and Viola are located 80 km (50  miles) off the coast and produced an average of 19,600 barrels a day in the past 12 months.
